private_information: I currently hold five disks stacked top to bottom as A, B, C, D, E where A is the smallest and E is the largest.
left_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration where the right peg contains all disks in order A, B, C, D, E from top to bottom and left and middle pegs are empty.

middle_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration where the right peg contains all disks in order A, B, C, D, E from top to bottom and left and middle pegs are empty.

right_peg.goal: Contribute to achieving the target configuration where the right peg contains all disks in order A, B, C, D, E from top to bottom and left and middle pegs are empty.

private_information: I coordinate information from the peg agents and must produce a single planning instance for a classical planner.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance with 5 disks and three pegs, suitable for the FastDownwards planner, such that the goal is all disks moved from left to right respecting the rules.

init.disk_order: A is smallest, E is largest

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are five disks labeled A, B, C, D, E from smallest (A) to largest (E).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
Never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks A, B, C, D, E from top to bottom; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has disks A, B, C, D, E from top to bottom; left and middle pegs are empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the left peg. Provide a concise, machine readable description of the disks currently on your peg listed top to bottom and the legal local capability that your peg supports, namely that it can only move the top disk to another peg if that move respects the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use your private information and the public information to produce a single-line state description identifying your peg name and the ordered list of disks from top to bottom. Also list the local rule that only the top disk can be moved and that it can only be placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the middle peg. Provide a concise, machine readable description of the disks currently on your peg listed top to bottom and the legal local capability that your peg supports, namely that it can only move the top disk to another peg if that move respects the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use your private information and the public information to produce a single-line state description identifying your peg name and the ordered list of disks from top to bottom. Also list the local rule that only the top disk can be moved and that it can only be placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the right peg. Provide a concise, machine readable description of the disks currently on your peg listed top to bottom and the legal local capability that your peg supports, namely that it can only move the top disk to another peg if that move respects the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use your private information and the public information to produce a single-line state description identifying your peg name and the ordered list of disks from top to bottom. Also list the local rule that only the top disk can be moved and that it can only be placed on an empty peg or on a larger disk.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at encoding classical planning problems in PDDL for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the peg state inputs and the public information. The domain must encode pegs, disks, the ordering relation, and a move action that moves a top disk from one peg to another while enforcing that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one. The problem must define the initial state with five disks A through E on the left peg with the correct ordering and the goal state with those disks stacked in order on the right peg. Target the FastDownwards solver by producing STRIPS-compatible PDDL. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive concise state descriptions from the three peg agents as inputs. Integrate these state descriptions with the public information to produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. The domain and problem must be self-contained and explicitly encode disk sizes and legal moves. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
